description.narrative: In the year 2008 Arid Lands Development Focus Kenya (ALDEF-K) partnering with Finish Embassy initiated a project that resulted in training of 40 paralegals in two divisions of Wajir district. The purpose of the project was to enable the marginalized commun ities living in Wajir District to access justice enjoy their legal rights as well as access other development benefits. The training of this group has raised great interest in the community regarding the subject of paralegals. The trained paralegals have already formed a network opened an office and are engaged in advocacy and awareness raising in the community. However due to the vastness of the County and the high number of the un served population the services offered by the few trained paralegals are n ot adequate to cover the County. It is based on this that ALDEF K intends to scale up this project while addressing key challenges of human rights violations in the County. In essence the project seeks to build the capacity of 50 paralegals in Habaswein an d Wajir South districts in the County. The project is further expected to strengthen and consolidate the paralegal services in the larger Wajir County by nurturing and mentoring the once trained the paralegals will use their skills to help community membe rs with legal issues. . As part of the practical training the trainees will get a chance to visit 4 existing paralegals network and offering paralegals services in the communities in the County. Once trained the paralegals will use their skills to help com munity members with legal issues. The project expects the society to become more informed on legal issues. The training will use three basic training materials. These include the paralegal curriculum the paralegal manual and the Paralegal training Handbook . Other legal materials may also be used to supplement the core training materials. As part of the practical training the trainees will get a chance to visit institutions for administration of justice. The trainees will visit the police stations the prison and the Magistrate court in Wajir. The training will be expected to take a total of one year. The trained paralegals will also network have grass root linkages and synergy. Since the trainees will be selected at the locational level they will elect divisi onal representatives who will discuss issues from the locations and also link them to umbrella paralegal network at the district level.
